meanings.definition: The act of predicting or foreshadowing future events.
meanings.sent1: Her omening of rain made her bring an umbrella.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds were an omening of the storm to come.
meanings.sent3: The cat's strange behavior was an omening of visitors arriving.
meanings.sent4: The sudden drop in temperature was an omening of the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The old man's accurate omening of the outcome amazed everyone.

meanings.definition: A sign or indication of what is to come.
meanings.sent1: The distant thunder was an omening of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The omening of a full moon meant a night of bright light.
meanings.sent3: The broken mirror was an omening of bad luck for the superstitious.
meanings.sent4: The omening of a shooting star brought hope to the young couple.
meanings.sent5: The omening of a rainbow after the rain filled them with joy.
